summary.Title: Senior Global Tax/Mobility Specialist
summary.Presentation: Are you a passionate Senior Global Mobility Specialist with knowledge in both personal tax and global mobility? Do you have the desire to work with the full span of operational, tactical, and strat

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Are you a passionate Senior Global Mobility Specialist with knowledge in both personal tax and global mobility? Do you have the desire to work with the full span of operational, tactical, and strategic Global Mobility tasks, ensuring global mobility processes, polices and strategies are effectively followed and implemented across Semco Maritime? Then this might be the right match for you.

Your position

As our new Senior Global Tax/Mobility Specialist, you will be part of a Global People & Culture department. Semco is a global project organization, and we send manpower, Expat, Service technicians across the world. You will play a key role in supporting and advising the business both in the tender face and when executing the projects. Your focus will be to secure that we are compliant within personal tax, work permit, social security etc. Shaping and driving global mobility strategy, ensuring our processes are robust and effectively implemented across borders. You will be part of a dedicated and skilled People & Culture team, collaborating closely with HR Business Partners, business leaders and other support functions worldwide to support Semco Maritime’s growth and global operations.

At Semco Maritime safety is a core value, and in this role, you will contribute to maintaining and promoting a strong safety culture while delivering innovative solutions. Above all, your work will make a real change for the global energy sector.

Your place of work will be either our Global HQ in Esbjerg or our Nordhavn office in Copenhagen. The position is full-time and offers the opportunity to make a significant impact on a global scale.

"Semco Maritime is on a journey to shape the future of Global Mobility in a growing global business – join us on this journey." – Maibrit Lykke, Head of HR Services & Processes

Your tasks & responsibilities

As a Senior Global Mobility Specialist, you will take the lead on strategic and operational mobility initiatives that ensure compliance and enable seamless employee transitions across borders.

Your tasks will include but are not limited to:

  • Collaborate with our Finance, Rewards, People & Culture and Legal teams to design and execute global mobility policies and programs
  • Provide support and guidance on immigration and personal tax globally  
  • Manage and be responsible for international relocations, and the related processes
  • Engage with our external vendors and build relationships to, relocation, personal tax, insurance and pension providers and build up internal knowledge
  • Drive the design, governance and management of our global benefits, mobility programs and policies
  • Help our employees with relocation, secondments and short-term assignments, in conjunction with our relocation and mobility tax providers
  • Provide advice on international personal tax clarifications in collaboration with our external advisors
  • Supporting and adhering to health, safety, and environmental standards, in all activities

Your profile & qualifications

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated specialist who thrives in a global, fast-paced environment. You ideally come with min. 10 years of experience from a similar position in an international environment, where you have worked within a corporate setting and have gained expertise with global mobility and personal tax. As person you are structured, proactive, with a collaborative approach and the ability to navigate complex challenges.

To succeed in this position, we imagine you have:

  • Extensive knowledge in advising on personal tax to our different global projects
  • Experience in building up Global Mobility policies, procedures, and can confidently deliver change to this area
  • Strong knowledge and experience within global mobility from an HR perspective
  • Thrive working in a fast-paced, growing company
  • Strong communication skills in both Danish and English
  • A team-oriented mindset and a passion for continuous improvement.

Welcome to Semco Maritime

At Semco Maritime, we create change. For people. For projects. And for the global energy sector. With us, you will join a community of over 2,500 of the most dedicated thinkers and doers in the energy industry who are driving real change and making their own personal mark on the global energy landscape.

While everyone knows why the energy transition is vital, we are concerned with the journey. How to get there. By providing the answers needed to make change real. Because we believe that global energy ambitions can only be realized through hard work and clever pragmatic solutions. This is what we do. This is what we invite you to participate in.

Safety is at the core of everything we do, and we are committed to protecting our people, partners, and the planet as we work towards a sustainable energy future.

So yes, working for us will change the energy sector – and may well change you too.

Care to join the movement?

Change. With us.
